member.summary: Enumeration of the scopes available through MusicBrainz OAuth2 authentication.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.None
member.summary: No authorization requested.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.Everything
member.summary: Request all available permissions (not recommended).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.Profile
member.summary: View the user's public profile information (e.g. username and time zone).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.Email
member.summary: View the user's email address.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.Tag
member.summary: View and modify the user's private tags.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.Rating
member.summary: View and modify the user's private ratings.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.Collection
member.summary: View and modify the user's private collections.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.SubmitIsrc
member.summary: Submit new ISRCs to the database.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope.SubmitBarcode
member.summary: Submit barcodes to the database.

member.name: T:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include
member.summary: Enumeration of additional information that can be requested to be included in query results.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.None
member.summary: No extra information requested.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Artists
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked artists.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Collections
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked collections.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Labels
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked labels.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Recordings
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked recordings.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.ReleaseGroups
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked release groups.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Releases
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked releases.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Works
member.summary: Include information about directly-linked works.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.ArtistCredits
member.summary: Include artist credits for all releases and recordings.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.DiscIds
member.summary: Include Disc IDs for all media in the release.
member.remarks: Only valid on queries for releases; implies .

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Isrcs
member.summary: Include ISRC values for all recordings.
member.remarks: Only valid in combination with .

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Media
member.summary: Include information about media for all releases (track count and format).
member.remarks: Only valid on queries for releases; implied by either or .

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.UserCollections
member.summary: Include private collections of the authenticated user.
member.remarks: Requires authentication. Applies only to queries for collections.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.VariousArtists
member.summary: Only include releases where the artist is credited on one or more tracks, but not on the release itself.
member.remarks: Only valid on artist queries, and only in combination with .

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Aliases
member.summary: Include aliases.
member.remarks: Aliases are not ordered, and only valid on queries for areas, artists, labels or works.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Annotation
member.summary: Include the annotation.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Ratings
member.summary: Include ratings.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Tags
member.summary: Include tags.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.UserRatings
member.summary: Like , but only returns the rating(s) set by the authenticated user.
member.remarks: Requires authentication.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.UserTags
member.summary: Like , but only returns the tag(s) set by the authenticated user.
member.remarks: Requires authentication.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.Genres
member.summary: Include genres (i.e. tags from the genre list).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include.UserGenres
member.summary: Like , but only returns the genre(s) set by the authenticated user.
member.remarks: Requires authentication.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Interfaces.IPagedQueryResults`2.AsStream
member.summary: Gets the streaming form of this set of query results.
member.returns: The streaming form of this set of query results, suitable for enumeration (e.g. by foreach or await foreach).
member.remarks:
Enumerating the return value is equivalent to enumerating this result set and then calling or and processing those results, and so on until there are no more results to process.
Operating on this set of paged results while the streaming form is in use is not recommended, because it will interfere with the streaming enumeration.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.OAuth2.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new OAuth2 client instance.
An HTTP client will be created when needed and can be discarded again via the method.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.OAuth2.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new OAuth2 client instance using a specific HTTP client.
member.param: The HTTP client to use.

Indicates whether this OAuth2 client should take ownership of .
If this is , it remains owned by the caller; this means will throw an exception and will release the reference to without disposing it.
If this is , then this object takes ownership and treat it just like an HTTP client it created itself; this means will dispose of it (with further requests creating a new HTTP client) and will dispose the HTTP client too.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.OAuth2.CreateAuthorizationRequest(System.Uri,MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.AuthorizationScope,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the URI to use to request an authorization code.
member.param: The URI that should receive the authorization code; use for out-of-band requests.
The authorization scopes that should be included in the authorization code.

Any string the application wants passed back after authorization; it will be included in the request sent to . For example, this can be a CSRF token from your application. This parameter is optional, but strongly recommended.

MusicBrainz supports the use of "Proof Key for Code Exchange" (PKCE) by clients. This is strongly recommended to avoid authorization code interception attacks.
See RFC 7636 for the process of generating a code_verifier and then a code_challenge (passed here) based on that.
Either "S256" (recommended) or "plain" (the default if not specified).
Requests offline use (a refresh token will be provided alongside the access token).
If , the user will be required to confirm authorization even if the requested scopes have already been granted.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.OAuth2.GetBearerToken(System.String,System.String,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Exchanges an authorization code for a bearer token.
member.param: The authorization code to be used. If the request succeeds, this code will be invalidated.
The client secret associated with .
The URI to redirect to (or for out-of-band requests); must match the request URI used to obtain .

If you're using PKCE, pass the code_verifier here. The request will be rejected if it doesn't agree with the challenge and challenge method used for the authorization request as generated via . The process is described in detail by RFC 7636.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Query.BrowseAllAreas(MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Interfaces.Entities.ICollection,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include)
member.summary: Returns the areas in the given collection.
member.param: The collection whose contained areas should be retrieved.
The maximum number of results to get in one request (1-100; default is 25).
The offset at which to start (i.e. the number of results to skip).
Additional information to include in the result.
member.returns:
The requested areas.
Note that this may use multiple "paged" requests to the web service. As such, an item can potentially be returned more than once: once at the end of a page, then again in the next page, if a new entry was inserted earlier in the sequence. Similarly, a result may be skipped if an item that was already returned is deleted (but deletions are far less likely).
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

Note that this may use multiple "paged" requests to the web service. As such, an item can potentially be returned more than once: once at the end of a page, then again in the next page, if a new entry was inserted earlier in the sequence. Similarly, a result may be skipped if an item that was already returned is deleted (but deletions are far less likely).
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

member.name: P:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Query.DelayBetweenRequests
member.summary: The amount of seconds to leave between requests. Set to 0 (or a negative value) to send all requests as soon as they are made.
member.remarks: Note that this is a global delay, affecting all threads. When querying the official MusicBrainz site, setting this below the default of one second may incur penalties (ranging from rate limiting to IP bans). When setting this to 0 for maximum throughput, can be used to avoid making too many requests and trigger these penalties.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Query.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new MusicBrainz query client instance.
An HTTP client will be created when needed and can be discarded again via the method.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Query.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new MusicBrainz query client instance using a specific HTTP client.
member.param: The HTTP client to use.

Indicates whether this MusicBrainz query client should take ownership of .
If this is , it remains owned by the caller; this means will throw an exception and will release the reference to without disposing it.
If this is , then this object takes ownership and treat it just like an HTTP client it created itself; this means will dispose of it (with further requests creating a new HTTP client) and will dispose the HTTP client too. Note that in this case, any default request headers set on will not be saved and used for further clients.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Query.LookupDiscId(System.String,System.Int32[],MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Include,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Looks up the specified disc ID.
member.param: The disc ID to look up. When is specified, this can be "-" to indicate that only a fuzzy TOC lookup should be done.

The TOC (table of contents) to use for a fuzzy lookup if has no exact matches. The array should contain the first track number, last track number and the address of the disc's lead-out (in sectors), followed by the start address of each track (in sectors).
Additional information to include in the result.
If , all media types are considered for a fuzzy lookup; otherwise, only CDs are considered.
If , CD stubs are not returned.
member.returns: The result of the disc ID lookup. This can be a single disc or CD stub, or a list of matching releases.
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

Additional information to include in the result.
If , all media formats are considered for a fuzzy lookup; otherwise, only CDs are considered.
If , CD stubs are not returned.
member.returns: The result of the disc ID lookup. This can be a single disc or CD stub, or a list of matching releases.
member.param: The cancellation token to cancel the operation.

member.name: M:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.Query.FindAllAnnotations(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for annotations using the given query.
member.param: The search query to use.
The maximum number of results to get in one request (1-100; default is 25).
The offset at which to start (i.e. the number of results to skip).
If set to , this disables advanced query syntax.
member.returns:
All results of the search request.
Note that this may use multiple "paged" requests to the web service. As such, an item can potentially be returned more than once: once at the end of a page, then again in the next page, if a new entry was inserted earlier in the sequence. Similarly, a result may be skipped if an item that was already returned is deleted (but deletions are far less likely).
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

remarks.para: When is specified as , certain special query characters are escaped automatically, for ease of use. This corresponds to using "Indexed Search" on MusicBrainz.

Otherwise, the full Lucene query syntax applies. This corresponds to using "Indexed Search with Advanced Query Syntax" on MusicBrainz. The following fields are available for the Lucene query:
FieldDescription
entitythe MBID of the annotated entity
namethe name of the annotated entity
textthe content of the annotation (includes wiki formatting)
typethe type of the annotated entity
Query terms without a field specifier will search the name, text and type fields.
See the MusicBrainz Search API Docs for more details.

member.returns: The search request, including the initial results.
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

member.summary: Searches for areas using the given query.
member.param: The search query to use.
The maximum number of results to get in one request (1-100; default is 25).

member.returns:
All results of the search request.
Note that this may use multiple "paged" requests to the web service. As such, an item can potentially be returned more than once: once at the end of a page, then again in the next page, if a new entry was inserted earlier in the sequence. Similarly, a result may be skipped if an item that was already returned is deleted (but deletions are far less likely).
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

remarks.para: When is specified as , certain special query characters are escaped automatically, for ease of use. This corresponds to using "Indexed Search" on MusicBrainz.

Otherwise, the full Lucene query syntax applies. This corresponds to using "Indexed Search with Advanced Query Syntax" on MusicBrainz. The following fields are available for the Lucene query:
FieldDescription
aidthe area's MBID
aliasan alias attached to the area
areathe area's name
beginthe area's begin date
commentthe area's disambiguation comment
endthe area's end date
endeda flag indicating whether or not the area has ended
isoan ISO 3166-1/2/3 code attached to the area
iso1an ISO 3166-1 code attached to the area
iso2an ISO 3166-2 code attached to the area
iso3an ISO 3166-3 code attached to the area
sortnamethe area's sort name
typethe area's type
Query terms without a field specifier will search the alias, area and sortname fields.
See the MusicBrainz Search API Docs for more details.

The maximum number of results to get in one request (1-100; default is 25).
The offset at which to start (i.e. the number of results to skip).
If set to , this disables advanced query syntax.
member.returns:
All results of the search request.
Note that this may use multiple "paged" requests to the web service. As such, an item can potentially be returned more than once: once at the end of a page, then again in the next page, if a new entry was inserted earlier in the sequence. Similarly, a result may be skipped if an item that was already returned is deleted (but deletions are far less likely).
member.exception: When the web service reports an error.
When something goes wrong with the request.

remarks.para: When is specified as , certain special query characters are escaped automatically, for ease of use. This corresponds to using "Indexed Search" on MusicBrainz.

Otherwise, the full Lucene query syntax applies. This corresponds to using "Indexed Search with Advanced Query Syntax" on MusicBrainz. The following fields are available for the Lucene query:
FieldDescription
aliasan alias attached to the series
commentthe disambiguation comment for the series
seriesthe name of the series
sidthe MBID of the series
typethe series' type
taga tag attached to the series
Query terms without a field specifier will search the alias and series fields.
See the MusicBrainz Search API Docs for more details.

member.summary: Creates a submission request for setting a barcode on one or more releases.

The ID of the client software submitting data.
This has to be the application's name and version number. The recommended format is "application-version", where version does not contain a dash.
It will be included in the edit(s) registered by the MusicBrainz server for this submission.
member.exception: When is blank.

member.name: T:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus
member.summary: Enumeration of the release status values.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus.Bootleg
member.summary: An unofficial/underground release that was not sanctioned by the artist and/or the record company. This includes unofficial live recordings and pirated releases.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus.Official
member.summary: Any release officially sanctioned by the artist and/or their record company. Most releases will fit into this category.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus.Promotion
member.summary: A give-away release or a release intended to promote an upcoming official release (e.g. pre-release versions, releases included with a magazine, versions supplied to radio DJs for air-play).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus.PseudoRelease
member.summary: An alternate version of a release where the titles have been changed. These don't correspond to any real release and should be linked to the original release using the translation and/or transliteration relationships.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus.Withdrawn
member.summary: A previously official release that was actively withdrawn from circulation by the artist and/or their record company after being released, whether to replace it with a new version with some changes or to just retire it altogether (e.g. because of legal issues).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseStatus.Cancelled
member.summary: A planned official release that was cancelled before being released, but for which enough info is known to still confidently list it (e.g. it was available for preorder).

member.name: T:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType
member.summary: Enumeration of the release type values (combines primary and secondary types).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Album
member.summary: An album, perhaps better defined as a "Long Play" (LP) release, generally consists of previously unreleased material (unless this type is combined with secondary types which change that, such as ).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Broadcast
member.summary: An episodic release that was originally broadcast via radio, television, or the Internet, including podcasts.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.EP
member.summary: An EP is a so-called "Extended Play" release and often contains the letters EP in the title. Generally an EP will be shorter than a full length release (an LP or "Long Play") and the tracks are usually exclusive to the EP, in other words the tracks don't come from a previously issued release. EP is fairly difficult to define; usually it should only be assumed that a release is an EP if the artist defines it as such.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Other
member.summary: Any release that does not fit or can't decisively be placed in any of the categories above.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Single
member.summary:
A single has different definitions depending on the market it is released for.
In the US market, a single typically has one main song and possibly a handful of additional tracks or remixes of the main track; the single is usually named after its main song; the single is primarily released to get radio play and to promote release sales.
The U.K. market (also Australia and Europe) is similar to the US market, however singles are often released as a two disc set, with each disc sold separately. They also sometimes have a longer version of the single (often combining the tracks from the two disc version) which is very similar to the US style single, and this is referred to as a "maxi-single". (In some cases the maxi-single is longer than the release the single comes from!)
The Japanese market is much more single driven. The defining factor is typically the length of the single and the price it is sold at. Up until 1995 it was common that these singles would be released using a mini-cd format, which is basically a much smaller CD typically 8 cm in diameter. Around 1995 the 8cm single was phased out, and the standard 12cm CD single is more common now; generally re-releases of singles from pre-1995 will be released on the 12cm format, even if they were originally released on the 8cm format. Japanese singles often come with instrumental versions of the songs and also have maxi-singles like the UK with remixed versions of the songs. Sometimes a maxi-single will have more tracks than an EP but as it's all alternate versions of the same 2-3 songs it is still classified as a single.
There are other variations of the single called a "split single" where songs by two different artists are released on the one disc, typically vinyl. The term "B-Side" comes from the era when singles were released on 7 inch (or sometimes 12 inch) vinyl with a song on each side, and so side A is the track that the single is named for, and the other side -side B- would contain a bonus song, or sometimes even the same song.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.AudioDrama
member.summary: An audio drama is an audio-only performance of a play (often, but not always, meant for radio). Unlike audiobooks, it usually has multiple performers rather than a main narrator.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Audiobook
member.summary: An audiobook is a book read by a narrator without music.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Compilation
member.summary:
A compilation, for the purposes of the MusicBrainz database, covers the following types of releases:
a collection of recordings from various old sources (not necessarily released) combined together. For example a "best of", retrospective or rarities type release.
a various artists song collection, usually based on a general theme ("Songs for Lovers"), a particular time period ("Hits of 1998"), or some other kind of grouping ("Songs From the Movies", the "Caf del Mar" series, etc).
The MusicBrainz project does not generally consider the following to be compilations:
a reissue of an album, even if it includes bonus tracks.
a tribute release containing covers of music by another artist.
a classical release containing new recordings of works by a classical artist.
a release containing two albums and/or EPs (these should be tagged as either an 'album' or an 'EP' depending on the circumstances).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.DJMix
member.summary: A DJ-mix is a sequence of several recordings played one after the other, each one modified so that they blend together into a continuous flow of music. A DJ mix release requires that the recordings be modified in some manner, and the DJ who does this modification is usually (although not always) credited in a fairly prominent way.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Demo
member.summary: A demo is typically distributed for limited circulation or reference use, rather than for general public release. It is a way for artists to pass along their music to record labels, producers, DJs or other artists.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.FieldRecording
member.summary: A release mostly consisting of field recordings (such as nature sounds or city/industrial noise).

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Interview
member.summary: An interview release contains an interview, generally with an artist.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Live
member.summary: A release that was recorded live.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.MixTape
member.summary: Promotional in nature (but not necessarily free), mix-tapes and street albums are often released by artists to promote new artists, or upcoming studio albums by prominent artists. They are also sometimes used to keep fans' attention between studio releases and are most common in rap & hip hop genres. They are often not sanctioned by the artist's label, may lack proper sample or song clearances and vary widely in production and recording quality. While mix-tapes are generally DJ-mixed, they are distinct from commercial DJ mixes (which are usually deemed compilations) and are defined by having a significant proportion of new material, including original production or original vocals over top of other artists' instrumentals. They are distinct from demos in that they are designed for release directly to the public and fans; not to labels.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Remix
member.summary: A release that primarily contains remixed material.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.Soundtrack
member.summary: A soundtrack is the musical score to a movie, TV series, stage show, computer game etc. In the specific cases of computer games, a game CD with audio tracks should be classified as a soundtrack: the musical properties of the CD are more interesting to MusicBrainz than the data properties.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.ReleaseType.SpokenWord
member.summary: Non-music spoken word releases.

member.name: T:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.TagVote
member.summary: A vote for a tag.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.TagVote.Up
member.summary: Vote up the tag. This adds 1 to the tag's vote count.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.TagVote.Down
member.summary: Vote down the tag. This subtracts 1 from the tag's vote count and hides it from you in the UI. If this brings a tag's vote count to 0 or below, the tag will be hidden for everyone.

member.name: F:MetaBrainz.MusicBrainz.TagVote.Withdraw
member.summary: Withdraws any vote you may have previously submitted for the tag.
